https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/72855/ : SUCCESS

1/ Intent of this commit is to start the Stateful DHCP without the RA.
Normal behavior is : if  RA message has the managed flag then the DHCPv6 client started, Now here we want to start the DHCPv6 client without having dependency on the RA message?

2/ man page says 
"if this is not specified, "solicit" is used when DHCPPrefixDelegation= is enabled and UplinkInterface=:self is specified in the [DHCPPrefixDelegation] section. Otherwise, defaults to "no", and the DHCPv6 client will be started when an RA is received".

Are we setting the [DHCPPrefixDelegation] [UplinkInterface] too?

Also please update the ethreal capture too
Ack

> Normal behavior is : if RA message has the managed flag then the DHCPv6 client started, Now here we want to start the DHCPv6 client without having dependency on the RA message?

Yes Ratan. That was the intent. 

> Are we setting the [DHCPPrefixDelegation] [UplinkInterface] too?

We should add these parameters as well, if (1) is acceptable to the community. I see IPMI has concerns about enabling this. So, there should be meson flags to get this set to the desired values via the recipes.
Added flags [DHCPPrefixDelegation] [UplinkInterface] to set WithoutRA=solicit.

Why are these extra params being added?
The man page states the DHCPPrefixDelegation, and UplinkInterface are only needed when WithoutRA is not EXPRESSLY assigned a value. Is there a compelling reason to add these configuration values? When the meson switch enables this feature WithoutRA is being explicitly assigned "solicit", making these additional systemd.network entries unnecessary.

These configurations are needed in specific combinations - to support the standalone DHCPv6 server (Without RA). This usecase is as per the RFC and it is a use case for the meta-ibm layer. Grouped at https://gerrit.openbmc.org/q/topic:WithoutRA

The default values under meta-phosphor will remain the same as the systemd.network defaults. So, this will not break any systems.
Removed extra parameters. The default value for WithOutRa will be "no", if nothing is specified.
Please add "tested by" section with all testcases you have verified
Ack

IMO this feature needs to be disabled by default. I expect most IPv6 environments are going to have both an RA and a DHCPv6 server if they're not using SLAAC. In that instance WithoutRA will not be consulted by systemd-networkd.
"information-request"

The systemd.network man page indicates the default value for this entry is "solicit" only when
"If this is not specified, "solicit" is used when DHCPPrefixDelegation= is enabled and UplinkInterface=:self is specified in the [DHCPPrefixDelegation] section"
Otherwise it is assigned a value of "no".
The default value here needs to follow that paradigm.
If some other value is desired the company desiring a new value needs to be responsible for enabling something different.
Ack
typo: information-request
Ack
Why doesn't the #ifdef also wrap the 'if (dhcp6())' portion of this too?
I agree. There is no need to make the call to dhcp6() if there is no action taken.
Ack
Not certain the new config file entries are required.
Please rephrase this to "Enable stateful dhcpv6 on factory reset"
Udated.
Can you add more details on why this change is needed to the commit message?

Added: A RA message(which has managed flag) is required to start the DHCPv6 client. 
Now, after this change, the DHCPv6 client starts without RA message. There will not be any dependence on RA message to start the DHCPv6 client.
This is the defaults for meta-ibm systems. Please mention same here to avoid confusions.
Updated.
This should not be set to 'self'. This should be read from the recipe. The default value for this is "auto"
Removed extra parameters. Please review updated code.
The commit message is out of date with the proposed changes.
Updated.
Have you tested to make sure the default config is 'no' before adding the meson override to your build?
Yes, As we are not providing any value , it will pick default value "no" and update it.
A few questions regarding the current state of the commit.
Is this description in need of an update?
Updated description with "Enables stateful DHCPv6 without RA."
ehthernet_interface: ?
Yes, for interface config.
'dhcp6-without-ra', type: 'boolean', value: false

'dhcp6-without-RA' has three possible string values: solicit, information request, and no.
So keeping the dhcp6-without-Ra type "string" and setting the default to 'no'.

```
#ifdef DHCP6_WITHOUT_RA
       config.map["DHCPv6"].emplace_back()["WithoutRA"].emplace_back("true")
#endif
```

dhcp6-without-RA' has three possible string values: solicit, information request, and no.
Here we are setting WithoutRA with "solicit" value which is a string.
